sentence:
Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion,

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it. News such as a plane crash is more exciting than the president announcing tax cuts or a new way to help homeless children.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it. News such as a plane crash is more exciting than the president announcing tax cuts or a new way to help homeless children. I feel that not being informed is better than reading a bunch of news that may make you feel down and frustrated.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it. News such as a plane crash is more exciting than the president announcing tax cuts or a new way to help homeless children. I feel that not being informed is better than reading a bunch of news that may make you feel down and frustrated. Uninformed people can lead to live very happy lives. The saying ignorance is bliss can really be true in this case. 

I would not say that we have a responsibility to know what is going on in the world. Citizens can choose whether to have an impact on different places in the world, and if they choose not to than it is ok. I think people need to do what is best for their mental, and if remaining uninformed is helpful, than that is what they should do. I think people have more of a responsibility to have at least some sort of idea what is going on their country. If you do not know about the pandemic by now than i think i would agree that it was a failed responsibility. I think engaging with current events can be helpful, it just depends on your perspective. Knowing what is going on around the world helps you can perspective, and allows you to realize how lucky you are to live in a place like the US. It can also cause you to gain a negative perspective however if you feel other countries are wronging the US, or if you feel threatened by other countries. There are many feelings that can come about from reading current events.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it. News such as a plane crash is more exciting than the president announcing tax cuts or a new way to help homeless children. I feel that not being informed is better than reading a bunch of news that may make you feel down and frustrated. Uninformed people can lead to live very happy lives. The saying ignorance is bliss can really be true in this case. 

I would not say that we have a responsibility to know what is going on in the world. Citizens can choose whether to have an impact on different places in the world, and if they choose not to than it is ok. I think people need to do what is best for their mental, and if remaining uninformed is helpful, than that is what they should do. I think people have more of a responsibility to have at least some sort of idea what is going on their country. If you do not know about the pandemic by now than i think i would agree that it was a failed responsibility. I think engaging with current events can be helpful, it just depends on your perspective. Knowing what is going on around the world helps you can perspective, and allows you to realize how lucky you are to live in a place like the US. It can also cause you to gain a negative perspective however if you feel other countries are wronging the US, or if you feel threatened by other countries. There are many feelings that can come about from reading current events. It is really up to the person to take whatever information they learn from the media and apply it to their lifestyle however they want.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, it does not make someone a bad citizen if they keep up with the news. I personally feel that media and news in general has the power to dictate how someone feels about different types of topics. If people watched all the news all the time, they would think the world was going to explode and probably be upset more often than not. I think having a general idea of what is going on in the world is smart, however overconsuming news could drive you mad. Not only this, but the media heavily favors the more negative and violent news because people are more prone to watch it. News such as a plane crash is more exciting than the president announcing tax cuts or a new way to help homeless children. I feel that not being informed is better than reading a bunch of news that may make you feel down and frustrated. Uninformed people can lead to live very happy lives. The saying ignorance is bliss can really be true in this case. 

I would not say that we have a responsibility to know what is going on in the world. Citizens can choose whether to have an impact on different places in the world, and if they choose not to than it is ok. I think people need to do what is best for their mental, and if remaining uninformed is helpful, than that is what they should do. I think people have more of a responsibility to have at least some sort of idea what is going on their country. If you do not know about the pandemic by now than i think i would agree that it was a failed responsibility. I think engaging with current events can be helpful, it just depends on your perspective. Knowing what is going on around the world helps you can perspective, and allows you to realize how lucky you are to live in a place like the US. It can also cause you to gain a negative perspective however if you feel other countries are wronging the US, or if you feel threatened by other countries. There are many feelings that can come about from reading current events. It is really up to the person to take whatever information they learn from the media and apply it to their lifestyle however they want. The news media is similar to social media in the way that it can change how you think. Social media causes constant comparison between yourself and others. News media and current events can cause constant comparison between your country and others. In conclusion, i think people do not have a definite responsibility to know what is going on in the world, or to keep up with the news.
